page.title: 07Churches in Alderney II
page.content: The Methodist Church seats 140 people(100 downstairs and 40 up in the balcony)It was built in 1851 and the minister thinks it was built by locals. The church is a simple rectangle.It is 34ft wide,40ft long and is painted white. The mother church is thought to be the Westminster Central Hall.On the wall by the altar are the Commandments,The Lords Prayer and the Creed.They are painted on a piece of wood fixed on the wall. John Wesley actually visited the island and is thought to have stayed at the Diver's Inn down at Braye Harbour. There is also a strong Salvation presence on the island led by Lieutenant Harris who is also the island youth officer.
